note.text: Following the September 11, 2001 attacks by al-Qaeda operatives, Operation Enduring Freedom began. The Taliban government fell in just two months, but the Afghan state government took longer to rebuild. A new constitution was ratified in 2004 and Hamid Karzai was democratically elected that year.
In 2008, U.S. forces shifted strategy to counterinsurgency and protecting Afghan civilians while supporting insurgentsâ€™ reintegration into society.
The U.S. began drawing down troops in 2011. The mission was formally completed in December 2014, but as of spring 2016, troop drawdown has been halted.
